    • Method Detail

      • splitConjunction

        public static java.util.List<Expression> splitConjunction(Expression expr)
        Split a conjunction into a list of its component expressions, removing any parentheses. Note: this is purely syntactic, e.g. both "true" and "false" just result in a singleton list.
        Parameters:
        expr - Expression to split.

      • splitDisjunction

        public static java.util.List<Expression> splitDisjunction(Expression expr)
        Split a disjunction into a list of its component expressions, removing any parentheses. Note: this is purely syntactic, e.g. both "true" and "false" just result in a singleton list.
        Parameters:
        expr - Expression to split.

      • splitOnBinaryOp

        public static void splitOnBinaryOp(Expression expr,
                                   int op,
                                   java.util.List<Expression> list)
        Split an expression into a list of its component expressions, based on a binary operator. Also remove any parentheses.
        Parameters:
        expr - Expression to split.
        op - Code of operator to split on (from ExpressionBinaryOp).
        list - Expression list in which to append resulting expressions.
